summary.para: Lists values that specify the location of the property description.
Disable showing property descriptions.
Show property descriptions within the description panel.
Show property descriptions within the tooltip.
Show property descriptions within the description panel and the tooltip.
Lists the values used to specify which properties can be expanded.
Expands properties according to its type converter.
Expands all properties.
Expands all properties that don't have a type converter.
Doesn't expand any property.
Lists the values used to specify the property display mode.
Doesn't show the property header.
Shows the property header to the left of the property value.
Doesn't show the property value.
Shows the property header at the top of the property value.
Lists values that specify when a Property Grid displays the Property Menu.
The property menu is shown by clicking the menu button or right-clicking the property.
The property menu is shown only by clicking the menu button.
The property menu is shown only by right-clicking the property.
The property grid control.
Initializes a new instance of the PropertyGridControl class with default settings.

Filters both by header content and value.

Represents a brush editor displayed within a dropdown window.
Initializes a new instance of the PopupBrushEdit class with default settings.
Serves as a base for classes that represent category definitions.
Initializes a new instance of the CategoryDefinition class with default settings.
Lists values that specify when the property definition is applied.
The definition is always shown.
The definition is shown if grouping is applied.
The definition is shown if grouping is not applied.
Represents item initializers.
Initializes a new instance of the InstanceInitializer class.
Creates an instance of the specified type.

member.name: P:DevExpress.Xpf.PropertyGrid.InstanceInitializer.Types

summary.para: Gets or sets a list of available instance types.

member.value: A list of available instance types.

summary.para: Lists values that specify which parts of the selected property should be highlighted.
Both the header cell and the value cell are highlighted.
Neither the header cell, nor the value cell is highlighted.
Only the value cell is highlighted.
Only the header cell is highlighted.
Contains settings specific to a brush editor.
Initializes a new instance of the BrushEditSettings class with default settings.
Represents the brush editor.
